comments.body: I'd expect an achievement from first discovering/picking up the egg, and any "repopulation" of them is up to the player to breed them. It likely wouldn't be much more in-depth than that.

I like the idea that when the sniffer population is big enough, they would start to naturally spawn in biomes. I suggest that they should be able to spawn in lush caves (as the lush caves don‚Äôt have a land mob), jungles and forests.
It doesn't seem likely for them to start naturally repopulating, it makes more sense for the player to repopulate sniffers themselves.
I think Capybaras live in swampy areas, not savannahs, but I'm not sure

It wouldn't let me make my own post about this, but I raise pigeons IRL! And have some ideas, so here is what my post was going to be:

I was playing some Minecraft and I showed my dad our epic little town and he said "where's the pigeon loft?" Adding homing/messenger/wild pigeons would be an interesting and cool addition I think. We "tame" pigeons in the real life, I think some real life characteristics of them could be added. They could eat seeds/food/mob drops off the ground, you could train them to always return home (they do this in real life!), you could add a sort of scroll item so you could send messages to other players (or just do it with the pre-existing book and quill), you can breed them into different color patterns, they capture other pigeons into their flock, if you also add hawks that could be a predator like the untamed wolves are to sheep (hawks also eat chickens), and they could serve as another source of getting feathers! There are other characteristics that could be added: pigeons always lay 2 eggs (a male and female), they naturally drop their feathers, that's all I can think of right now. Adding pigeons would be awesome, and you could eat them!
Please add a ostrich
A bit more detail please

Concept:

Tigers are not savanna animals, they are more like jungle animals.

And yes, we need those animals, and I look forward to hippos the most.

Since hippos are aggressive in real life, hippos should behave as hostile mobs (except Peaceful and Easy Difficulty) (Easy Difficulty should have them neutral like the polar bear) and have identical behavior to zoglins as they attack nearly every mob. Their natural habitat is rivers in the savannah.

Lions are neutral/hostile mobs and will attack zebras. They will sleep anytime like foxes.

Along with other animals mentioned, lions and hippos should be added to raise awareness of their endangerment. This is what Mojang did to the axolotl.

FYI, despite the hippo's aggressive behavior, hippos count as animals and not monsters, so they should not disappear when changing to Peaceful.

There are already also horses, donkeys, mules, allays, axolotls, and foxes. Those should be plenty.
no

since the point of adding axolotls is to bring awareness, it should be noted that this is commonly fatal in real life. They morph when in bodies of water with very high temperature (they like it cold), ph that is either too low or too high, or they are out of the water. Since they are losing their morphing genes, they often die when this happens. It should be a very small chance that morphing is successful, to spread awareness of axolotls and their habits.

Makes perfect sense.  Mules are kind of useless because they act exactly like donkeys, but with this feature there would be a reason to create a horse-donkey hybrid.  Best of both worlds.  I don't think this is overpowered at all.

Mules in real life are actually superior at hogh jumping too, they should be just as athletic as horses but able to wear chests too. Maybe a bit slower than horses in running, like 80%. But once you get a mule you shouldn't want anything else again

Since there has been no update to the End for a while, I was thinking perhaps you could add another mob that is only obtainable in the End Ships. I was thinking of it to be called ‚ÄúEndolotl‚Äù so basically it is another breed of axolotl that can only be found in the End. In the back end of the ships, there will be a cage with the ‚ÄúEndolotl‚Äù in it. You could add a new item called the ‚ÄúEnd Bucket‚Äù and to create it you need 3 pieces of Endstone. Then you collect the Endolotl and there you have it! It would give you more of a thrill if the End city has a ship in it. Can you please add it to PE edition? Thanks!

I personally have no issue with the ground mobs. But please for the love of all that's holy, get rid of the ghasts. Or at the least make them less hostile. Something! I am getting sick of their persistence, unpredictability, and overall they make it less fun to play.

I find the mobs are spawning insanely high in caverns on a personal server that's set to EASY. And the mobs are also each hard to kill. Also, Creepers are next to impossible to kill without them exploding, unless you spam them with arrows before they even get near you.

I‚Äôm literally going insane over this. My new realm is on normal mode, teaching my husband to play. We can‚Äôt explore more than 20 blocks before getting pummeled by magma cubes or Enderman (even not looking at them) or shooting ghasts, which spawn within 30 seconds of killing one. So we haven‚Äôt been able to find a fortress yet because all we do is fight off one mob or another. I wear a gold helmet but still hoglins attack me. The mobs are saturating my new realm and respawn continuously as if ultra hard mode or something, so we never get a break to just explore or mine resources.

This, all of this.

Ghasts are an absolute nuisance now. I'll shoot two of them down, and another one or two will spawn literally right in front of eyes, sometimes exactly where the last one was killed. They're way too common and there's no countermeasure
Having carnivores in the game actually participate in predation would be really cool. Polar bears lack any fun and unique behaviors, so I'm down with this!

Clouded Leopards - what can you do with them? You should be able to tame them with raw beef. They should be able to spawn in the Savannah and you should also be able to ride them by putting a saddle on them. They should be able to jump up to 3 feet.
